about.title: About Bilbo Tracker
about.description: Bilbo Tracker is a free workout tracking app designed to help you build strength using progressive overload principles.

method.title: The Training Method
method.description: The Bilbo method is a simple progressive overload system where you start at 50% of your 1RM and add weight each session until you can no longer complete the target reps. Then you start a new cycle with your improved 1RM.

privacy.title: Privacy First
privacy.description: All your data is stored locally in your browser. Optional cloud backup uses Google Drive's hidden app folder, which only this app can access.

attribution.title: Attribution
attribution.description: This app is inspired by training methods shared by the BilboTeam community.

about.disclaimer: This app is not affiliated with or endorsed by BilboTeam.

what1rm.a: 1RM stands for One Rep Maximum - the maximum weight you can lift for a single repetition. It's used as a baseline to calculate your training loads.

howSuggested.q: How is the suggested load calculated?
howSuggested.a: For the first session of a cycle, the suggested load is 50% of your base 1RM. For subsequent sessions, it's your last session's load plus your weight increment setting, rounded to your rounding step.

whyNoChange1RM.q: Why can't I change my 1RM mid-cycle?
whyNoChange1RM.a: The base 1RM is fixed during a cycle to provide consistent progression. When you finish a cycle and start a new one, you can update your base 1RM based on your improved performance.

whatStrength.q: What does the Strength badge mean?
whatStrength.a: Sessions marked as 'Strength' are logged after finishing a cycle but before starting a new one. They follow the same progression but are tracked separately from Bilbo phase sessions.

howSync.a: When enabled, your data is automatically saved to Google Drive after each session. It uses a hidden app-specific folder that only this app can access. Your data is never shared.

whatConflict.q: What happens if there's a sync conflict?
whatConflict.a: If your local data differs from the cloud backup, you'll be asked to choose which version to keep. This can happen if you use the app on multiple devices.

privacy.a: Yes. All data is stored locally in your browser. If you enable cloud backup, data is stored in your personal Google Drive account in a hidden folder. We don't have access to your data. Basic usage analytics may be collected but never includes personal workout details.
